righthandWords.words: She's going to take the driving test.|She failed the test.|She doesn't have a job or a car.|She can't drive.|She doesn't have a car.|She has a car.|She was late.|She wasn't late.

lefthandWords.words: She'll buy a car, if she passes the driving test.|If she'd practised, she'd have passed the driving test.|She'd buy a car if she had a job.|She'd buy a car if she could drive.|If she had a car, she'd drive to work.|If she didn't have a car, she wouldn't be able to drive to work.|If she'd taken the car, she wouldn't have been late.|If she hadn't taken the car, she would have been late.
